channel.title: What is the ADC Input impedance for connecting sensors?
channel.description: Hi, I'm trying to optimally filter a sensor while I read it from my Axoloti. I was wondering what the effective impedance is on the ADCs so I can design the last stage of my output filter. Thank you :grinning:

item.title: What is the ADC Input impedance for connecting sensors?
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

ADC_SMPR1 is configured for 84 samples (in axoloti_board.c)
The ADC clock is the APB2 clock (84MHz) divided by 4 (ADC_CCR_ADCPRE_DIV4 in mcuconfig.h), so I believe F_ADC is 21MHz. So the datasheet equation tells, using quoted typical Cadc and Radc values:

Rain = (84-0.5)/(21M*4p*ln(2^(12+2)))-6k
... = 83.5/(84E-6 *ln(16384))-6k
... = 96436 ohm
